page.title: 11The Llynfi Valley
page.content: {Caerau}is at the top of the{Llynfi {Valley.}It is called the{Llynfi Valley because the river{Llynfi}runs through it. The mountain near the river Llynfi is called Caerau mountain but on the ordinance survey map it is called{Mynydd y Caerau.}The mountain opposite is called the{Afan mountain. People believed the{Romans}built {fortresses on}the mountain that is what gave Caerau its name. The mountain today has been spoiled by people dumping{litter}and other waste materials on it. This rubbish can be harmful to the wild life on the mountain and the sheep which use it for grazing. If you go for a walk on the mountain it is a very pleasant. When they are in season it is possible to pick blackberries and wimberries there.
